info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 9 at 8:58AM CDT until June 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Cimarron River near Ripley affecting Payne County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Cimarron River near Ripley.
* WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect the Cimarron River to reach bankfull levels through Payne County. Small areas of agricultural land and oil wells located near the channel are isolated by water in cutoff channels along the river valley.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.1 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
